intro: Lobivia pectinifera var. haematantha, commonly known as the Crimson Lobivia, is a compact, spineless cactus native to the arid regions of South America. It features a globular or cylindrical stem that is typically green to reddish in color, often with a bluish or purplish tinge. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the warmer months, which are borne on long, slender pedicels. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to drought conditions. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
